            Bio
            Lindsay N. Hayes is a researcher in the Department of
            Neuroscience at Johns
            Hopkins University. She studies neuroinflammation and
            microglia biology in the context of health and disease.
            Lindsay uses both clinical samples and animal models to
            investigate the cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying
            neuroinflammation and how it impacts brain function and
            disease phenotypes.
            
            
            Education
            Johns Hopkins University | Baltimore,
            MD
            Postdoctoral Fellowship | February 2012 - February
            2018
            Brown University | Providence, RI
            NICHD | Bethesda, MD
            Ph.D. in Neuroscience | July 2006 - January 2012
            Evangel University | Springfield, MO
            B.S. in Chemistry | August 2002 - May 2006
